experiment_info.name: multistart_elite_selection
experiment_info.description: Run multiple short CMA-ES from different inits, continue only the best 1-2
experiment_info.hypothesis: Instead of running N full optimizations, run N short ones and continue only the most promising. More efficient budget allocation.

tuning_runs.notes: FAILED - worse than baseline on BOTH metrics. Multi-start overhead dominates any early-selection benefit.
FAILED - minimal multi-start (2 runs, keep 1) still worse than baseline. Score lower AND over budget.

conclusion.reason: Multi-start elite selection does NOT improve over single-start baseline
key_findings: 1. 4 runs, keep 2: Score=1.1422 @ 84.4 min - MUCH worse (overhead dominates)
2. 2 runs, keep 1: Score=1.1529 @ 67.0 min - still worse (even minimal multi-start fails)
3. Early generation fitness is NOT predictive of final solution quality
4. Multi-start overhead (spawning/evaluating parallel runs) outweighs any early-selection benefit
5. The baseline single-start approach with good initialization is already optimal
conclusion.recommendation: ABANDON multi-start elite selection family. Focus on improving single-start optimization quality instead.
